item.title: 天气将加剧洛杉矶火灾的风险
item.description: 在短暂的喘息之后，天气将再次对洛杉矶不利，这让消防员们得以在美国人口第二大城市的大火中取得进展，并为官员们开始相互指责提供了足够的喘息机会。【原文：The weather will once again turn against Los Angeles after a brief respite that allowed firefighters to gain ground on blazes across the second-most populous US city and offered enough pause for officials to begin trading accusations.】

item.title: 洛杉矶面临保险末日
item.description: 洛杉矶地区的大火仍在燃烧。虽然紧急救援队周五终于在大火中取得了进展，但官员们现在却在相互指责，称市政府自己的行为使灾难变得更加严重。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读最新消息以及我们对火灾的所有报道。【原文：The fires continue to burn across the Los Angeles area. While emergency teams finally gained ground on the blazes Friday, officials are now trading accusations that the city’s own actions have made the catastrophe worse. You can read the latest updates and all of our coverage on the fires on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 寒流持续，英国气温一夜降至零下 18.7 摄氏度
item.description: 在英国 15 年来最寒冷的一月夜晚，气温降至零下 18.7 摄氏度，寒风凛冽的天气仍在继续。【原文：Temperatures dropped to minus 18.7C in the UK's coldest January night in 15 years, as the wintry weather continues.】

item.title: 寒流持续，苏格兰小镇气温降至零下 18 摄氏度
item.description: 一夜之间，气温再次下降，苏格兰北部的一个小村庄在零下 18 摄氏度的低温中瑟瑟发抖。【原文：The mercury fell again overnight with a hamlet in northern Scotland shivering through a temperature of minus 18C.】

item.title: 消防机构将调查爱迪生公司与洛杉矶赫斯特火灾的可能联系
item.description: 爱迪生国际南加州公用事业公司表示，消防机构正在调查该公司的设备是否参与了圣费尔南多附近赫斯特大火的引燃。【原文：Edison International’s Southern California utility said fire agencies are investigating whether the company’s equipment was involved in the ignition of the Hurst Fire near San Fernando.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火将脆弱的加州保险市场推向极限
item.description:
随着大火的肆虐，这场灾难有可能打破加州气候风险与房屋保险之间脆弱的平衡。【原文：

As the fires rage on, the disaster threatens to upend the fragile balance between climate risk and home insurance in California.

】

item.title: 纽瑟姆下令调查洛杉矶野火期间消防栓干涸原因
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）在消防栓干涸后下令对管理该市供水系统的洛杉矶机构进行州级调查，这妨碍了保护家园免遭致命野火的努力。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom ordered a state investigation of the Los Angeles agencies running the city’s water systems after fire hydrants ran dry, hampering efforts to protect homes from deadly wildfires.】

item.title: 洛杉矶消防员正得到加拿大水弹飞机的援助
item.description:
30年来，这些飞机一直是加利福尼亚州防火系统的一部分。在气候变暖的世界中，此类跨境交易将变得更加重要。【原文：

For 30 years, the aircraft have been part of California's fire defenses. In a warming world, these types of cross-border deals will become more important.

】

item.title: 我们从有史以来最热的一年中学到了什么
item.description: 独立科学机构现已证实，2024 年是有记录以来最热的一年。我们的《绿色日报》特刊将介绍我们从这些数据中了解到的情况。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Independent scientific agencies have now confirmed 2024 was the hottest year on record. Our special edition of the Green Daily newsletter looks at what we learned from the data. You can read and share the full version of this story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 在有史以来最热的一年里，美国家庭使用了创纪录的电力来降温
item.description:
虽然人工智能在能源使用方面备受关注，但住宅领域的耗电量却远远超过其他领域，而且随着地球升温，耗电量还将增加。【原文：

While artificial intelligence has attracted scrutiny for energy use, the residential sector is far and away the biggest power suck — and it’s set to grow as the planet heats up.

】

item.title: 美国通过绿色燃料规定遏制部分食用油进口
item.description: 美国正着手遏制废食用油的进口，防止用于制造生物燃料的外国供应品获得利润丰厚的税收抵免。【原文：The US is moving to curb imports of used cooking oil, preventing foreign supplies used to make biofuels from qualifying for a lucrative tax credit.】

item.title: 伊顿峡谷以西的洛杉矶住宅在火灾前仍有电力供应
item.description: 随着人们开始关注本周洛杉矶野火肆虐的原因，有证据表明，尽管有大风警告，但靠近最致命火灾起火点的电线却没有被切断。【原文：As attention turns to the causes of this week’s devastating Los Angeles wildfires, evidence has emerged that power lines close to where one of the deadliest conflagrations started weren’t shut off, despite warnings about high winds.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火产生的野火烟雾是一种隐性健康成本
item.description:
吸入烟雾引起的呼吸道和心血管问题给医疗系统造成了数十亿美元的负担。【原文：

The respiratory and cardiovascular problems that come with smoke inhalation are a multibillion-dollar drag on the healthcare system.

】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火最新消息
item.description: 1 月 9 日，在加利福尼亚州马里布的 Palisades 大火中，消防员在太平洋海岸公路上用水管冲洗一座正在燃烧的建筑物。摄影师：吉尔-康奈利/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Firefighters hose down a smoldering building on the Pacific Coast Highway during the Palisades Fire in Malibu, California, on Jan. 9. Photographer: Jill Connelly/Bloomberg】

item.title: 加州禁止取消洛杉矶火灾灾区的保险合同
item.description: 加利福尼亚州禁止保险公司取消或不再续订洛杉矶受大火影响地区的住宅财产保险，大火本周摧毁了该市的大片地区。【原文：California banned insurers from canceling or not renewing residential property policies in the Los Angeles neighborhoods that were affected by the blazes that destroyed swaths of the city this week.】

item.title: 洛杉矶风力减弱，有助于控制致命火灾
item.description: 周五，洛杉矶的狂风将有所缓解，这为消防员提供了一个大展身手的机会，以扑灭已造成至少 10 人死亡、近 18 万人被迫逃离家园的大火。【原文：Flame-whipping winds in Los Angeles are set to ease Friday, offering firefighters a chance to make strides in battling blazes that have killed at least 10 and forced almost 180,000 people to flee their homes.】

item.title: 洛杉矶居民如何追踪火灾
item.description: 消防员在控制肆虐洛杉矶的致命大火方面取得了一些进展，但由于整个街区化为灰烬，造成的损失也在增加。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读最新消息以及我们对火灾的所有报道。【原文：Firefighters are making some progress on controlling the deadly blazes that have scorched Los Angeles, as the toll of destruction rises with entire neighborhoods reduced to ash. You can read the latest updates and all of our coverage on the fires on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 冬季风暴席卷美国南部，2,000 多架次航班停飞
item.description: 一场席卷美国南部的强大冬季风暴导致 2000 多架航班停飞、客运列车停运，并威胁到该地区的强降雪。【原文：A powerful winter storm sweeping the US South has grounded more than 2,000 flights, halted passenger trains and threatens the region with heavy snowfall.】

item.title: Constellation Energy 将以 164 亿美元收购 Calpine
item.description: Constellation Energy Corp. 同意以 164 亿美元的价格收购紧密控股的 Calpine Corp.，从而在美国各地增加数十个发电资产，因为美国的电力需求预计将激增。【原文：Constellation Energy Corp. agreed to acquire closely held Calpine Corp. for $16.4 billion to add scores of power generation assets across the US as the nation’s electricity demand is forecast to surge.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火肆虐，居民求助非营利组织值班人员
item.description:
随着毫无根据的阴谋论和垃圾信息在社交媒体上的传播，火热追踪应用程序已成为一种流行的信息来源。【原文：

With unfounded conspiracy theories and spam spreading on social media, the fire tracking app has become a popular source of information.

】

item.title: 密苏里州铅矿开采的有毒痕迹难以消除
item.description:
经过数十年的污染，该州整个县都成了超级基金所在地。随着清理工作的持续进行，剩余的矿山正在寻找新的需求。【原文：

Whole counties in the state are Superfund sites after decades of contamination. As the cleanup continues, remaining mines are eyeing new demand. 

】

item.title: 欧洲负电价损害 2030 年清洁能源目标
item.description: 市场分析公司极光能源（Aurora Energy）称，由于日益频繁的负价格阻碍了投资者对新项目的支持，欧洲有望无法实现其 2030 年清洁能源目标。【原文：Europe is on track to miss its 2030 targets for clean energy as increasingly frequent bouts of negative prices discourage investors from backing new projects, according to market analytics firm Aurora Energy.】

item.title: 寒流加剧，天气警告遍布欧洲
item.description: 欧洲大部分地区的气温将降至零度以下，气象机构警告说，多个国家将出现大雪。【原文：Temperatures are set to drop well below zero across much of Europe, with weather agencies warning of heavy snow in several countries.】

item.title: 洛杉矶居民被发送到手机上的虚假疏散警报吓坏了
item.description: 在南加州遭受灾难性火灾的第三天，一个疏散警报被错误地发送给洛杉矶县的 1000 万居民，20 多分钟后又被撤回，这加剧了紧张局势。【原文：An evacuation alert was mistakenly sent to 10 million Los Angeles County residents and then retracted more than 20 minutes later, adding to tensions as Southern California endured a third day of catastrophic fires.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火蔓延速度放缓，房屋和财产损失不断攀升
item.description: 随着洛杉矶大火进入第三天，美国第二大城市遭受的破坏继续增加。【原文：As the Los Angeles firefight ground through its third day, the toll of devastation across America’s second-largest city continued to rise.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火让保险公司一夜之间损失翻倍，达到 200 亿美元
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The potential cost for insurers of the devastation caused by the Los Angeles wildfires is now expected to surpass $20 billion, according to analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co., doubling their estimate from just a day before.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火为何如此惨烈
item.description: 尽管消防员奋力控制洛杉矶及周边地区的多处大火，但估计造成的损失已使这场大火成为该地区几十年来最严重的自然灾害。火灾的起因仍在调查中，但近期的天气模式以及该地区独特的环境条件助长了火势的蔓延。以下是大火造成如此严重破坏的原因。【原文：Even as firefighters battled to contain multiple blazes in Los Angeles and the surrounding area, the estimated damages already have made the fires the region’s worst natural disaster in decades. How the fires started remains under investigation, but recent weather patterns, as well as the region’s unique environmental conditions, helped fuel their spread. Here’s what to know about why the fires have been so ruinous.】

item.title: 科学家将蚊子变成抗击疾病的微型武器
item.description:
数以亿计的受细菌感染的蚊子正在被城市武器化。【原文：

Billions of bacteria-infected mosquitoes are being weaponized by cities.

】

item.title: 美国电力公司以 28 亿美元出售 Wires 股份
item.description: 据能源公司报道，美国电力公司已同意将其输电业务的股份出售给 KKR 和 PSP Investments 之间的战略合作伙伴。【原文：American Electric Power Co. has agreed to sell a stake in its transmission business to a strategic partnership between KKR and PSP Investments, the energy company reported.】

item.title: 贝莱德离开主要气候组织，华尔街人士纷纷出走
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. 因其在全球变暖问题上的努力而成为共和党政客的攻击目标，该公司将退出全球最大的气候融资组织之一。【原文：BlackRock Inc. is exiting one of the world’s biggest climate finance groups for investors after being targeted by Republican politicians for its efforts on global warming.】
